sentence: Last year was an exceptional year for Home Depot (NYSE:) stock, as HD stock is up over 31% in the last 12 months.

As I see it, there are several reasons for investors to be excited about Home Depot stock.

On the surface, that may sound like a ridiculous statement.

But for Home Depot, that can be a positive sign.

During its Investor Day event in December 2019, healthy consumer spending, low unemployment and rising wages as three reasons for optimism.

One Home Depot Is Still Developing

Another perceived catalyst for Home DepotÃ¢ÂÂs long-term growth is the companyÃ¢ÂÂs omnichannel Ã¢ÂÂOne Home DepotÃ¢ÂÂ initiative.
Helping consumers get the products they need anytime, anyway, anywhere is not inexpensive.
The anticipated cost of One Home Depot is $11 billion, and as part of that investment, the company is spending $1.2 billion to create 150 new distribution facilities.
When all facilities are operating, Home Depot will be able to provide same-day or next-day delivery to 90% of the country.
Over time, analysts see this as being a source of growth for Home Depot.
However, in the short term, the company is still absorbing those costs.This is at a time when the company is already forecasting tighter margins and revenue that is below analystsÃ¢ÂÂ expectations.
Nonetheless, although the move toward omnichannel may be expensive, most industry analysts consider it to be essential.
Particularly since Amazon (NASDAQ:) is rumored to be looking into finding a foothold in the home-building sector.
